To ensure we could match these risks to possible temperature–rainfall combinations that occurred in the projected data but not during the 2004–2013 period, we used inverse distance weighting to generate estimates of the salmonellosis risk for temperature–rainfall combinations surrounding the existing combinations ( Isaaks and Srivastava 1989). We then matched this set of risks at possible temperature–rainfall combinations to the projected temperature–rainfall combination for each day in 2030 and 2050, giving the daily relative risk of salmonellosis in 2030 and 2050.
